question: What are the steps to declare a 2-for-1 bonus issue in the system?
answer: To declare a 2-for-1 bonus issue in the system, follow these steps: 1. Navigate to the Stockbrokerage Module. 2. Click on Public Offer/Right Issues. 3. Select Bonus Txns. 4. Search or input the Stock code. 5. Choose the appropriate date. 6. Input '2' in the first box under the units label and '1' in the second box. 7. Enter your comment and save the changes. 8. After saving, you can view the allocation to see what was allocated to each portfolio.

question: Could you outline the procedure to access a customer's mutual fund holdings statement?
answer: To access a customer's mutual fund holdings statement, follow these steps: 1. Navigate to Reports. 2. Select Business Intelligence Reports. 3. Expand the Mutual Funds report category. 4. Launch the first report listed under that category. 5. Choose your fund from the available options. 6. Enter the customer AID and the relevant date. 7. Click 'View Report' to generate the statement.

question: When a customer needs to update or remove multilevel approvers for their modules, what steps should they follow?
answer: To update or remove multilevel approvers for your modules, follow these steps: 1. Click on the Security module. 2. Navigate to Approvers within the Security module. In the Approvers form, use the drop-down menu beside the module button to select the modules you wish to configure. 3. In the User section of the form (on the left side), select the user and add each user in the order you want them to approve before it reaches the GL. Click Continue on the prompt that appears when adding users. 4. To remove existing multilevel approvers, select the approvers listed under the Approvers section, choose the ones you want to remove, and press Remove. Repeat this process to remove all undesired approvers. 5. Save your changes once you have finished updating the configuration.

question: How do I extract my running investments using the interest position form?
answer: Navigate to Asset Management. Select Treasury Bills PL. Click on Interest Position. Select your value date to view all running transactions as of that date. Expand the Filter & Export button. Choose the option to export to Excel.

question: What is the procedure for updating the next coupon date for a bond?
answer: Click on Bonds. Click on Payment Coupon Schedule. Search for the bond and select it. Click on Add Date. Edit the newly added date to reflect the last coupon payment date. Save the changes.

question: I want to configure multi-level approvers for the investment fund module.
answer: 1. Click on 'Security Module'. 2. Click on 'Approvers'. 3. Ensure that the 'Modules' field is set to 'Investment Fund'. 4. On the right, add the people who should approve the investment and click 'Save'.

question: How do I access the GL Audit Call Over report with a wide date range?
answer: 1. Go to the Reports module. 2. Click on 'Reports - IDIA Business Intelligence' (the second menu under the report module, not the first one). 3. Expand the Accounts/GL report category. 4. Click on GL Audit Call Over Report and launch it. 5. Input your parameters. 6. Expand the Filter & Export section and export the report to Excel if needed.

question: We require the bond/t-bill liquidation module in InfoWARE to enable us to process a pending final redemption. How can we grant users the necessary permissions for this module?
answer: To grant users the necessary permissions, follow these steps: 1. Launch the application. 2. Navigate to the security menu. 3. Click on Security Permission. 4. Select the User/Group by clicking on the green drop-down button in front of it. 5. Click on Add, and a new modal will appear. 6. Click on the arrow drop-down beside the 'Filter & Export' button. 7. Change the Search type from 'Type' to 'Description' by clicking on the arrow-down button. 8. Input 'Bond' in the last form box and press the Tab button on your keyboard. 9. A list of menu/forms containing 'Bond' will appear. Scroll down to where you see 'Bond Liquidation.' 10. Click on it, change the 'Type of Access:' to Full Access, and then click on Add. 11. Repeat the same search process for 'Tbill' and click OK. 12. You will be returned to the previous menu; then click Save.

question: How do I restructure a loan or perform a rollover in the application?
answer: Navigate to the Loan Partial Liquidation menu. Select the loan and partially liquidate it. The system will carry over the details of the previous loan to the Loan Creation menu. Review and resave the loan details as needed.

question: How do I perform the 'Cert in Hand' process?
answer: To perform the 'Cert in Hand' process, follow these steps: 1. Navigate to the 'Stock Brokerage Module'. 2. Go to 'Trade/OMS' and select 'Cert in Hand'. 3. Call up the customer. 4. Click on 'New' and input the required information. 5. Save the changes.

question: What are the steps to enable OTP for Ebiz login?
answer: To enable OTP for Ebiz login, follow these steps: 1. Navigate to the 'Administration Module'. 2. Go to 'Parameter' and select 'Ebusiness'. 3. Choose the 'Ebiz Login OTP Pin Option'. 4. Read the explanation provided and select the appropriate setting.

question: How can I review trading activities and find the last login date for DMA customers?

question: How can I grant agent involvement to a customer and profile customers under the agent?

question: How do I add customers under an agent's profile?
answer: Navigate to 'Maintain >> Customer Group Ebiz'. Enter the agent's Cust AID. Add the customers under the agent's profile.

question: To determine whether a customer is a DMA Customer, follow these steps:
answer: 1. Click on OPS/Maintain Module. 2. Click on Customer Group Management. 3. On the Right Hand Side (DMA) group, expand the filter column, filter by CustAID, and input the customer ID. 4. question: To temporarily disable the E-guard due to the client portal's inability to send out E-guard emails, follow these steps:

question: How do I resolve the issue with the inability to upload trade files on IDIA ERP?

question: How do I add a user to the Account group under Group Membership?

question: What should I do to delete an account officer from the application?
answer: To delete an account officer from the application, follow these steps: 1. Go to the 'Officers Menu' in the 'OPS/Maintain Module'. 2. Click on 'Find' to search for the account officer. 3. Select the account officer by clicking 'OK'. 4. Click on 'Delete'.

question: How can I fix the error encountered during Export?

question: The missing Service Sub menu of the Financial module was actually moved to the Asset Management module. What steps should be taken to correct this?
answer: To move the Service Sub menu from the Asset Management module back to the Financial module, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the application. 2. question: I want to add a customer to the DMA (Direct Market Access) group.

question: How do I configure receipt parameters after the client provides the Accounts GL?

question: How do I onboard a customer on the application?

question: How do I process a reversal for an existing or running investment?
answer: To process a reversal for an existing or running investment, follow these steps: 1. Log in to the application. 2. Navigate to the Asset Management module and click on the Investment menu. 3. question: Kindly guide on how to modify existing commission rate for clients on Infoware.
answer: To modify the existing commission rate for clients on Infoware, follow these steps: 1. Click on Grad Commission Rates. 2. Click on ADD GROUP. 3. In the display window, type in the name of the new Commission Group. 4. Input the Account ID for both Buy & Sell (The Brokerage Commission Ledger for both Buy & Sell). 5. Input the Asset Class (So the system knows the Asset Class you are creating the commission against). 6. Input the Min & Max Value (This is not compulsory). 7. Input the Fixed Amount & Part Per Mill (This is not compulsory). 8. Click on SAVE. 9. Click on Group List and scroll down to see the newly created group in the dropdown. 10. Click on NEW. 11. In the row that gets inserted (Note: From the Account ID downwards would have been pre-populated based on the information you inputted), configure Grad. Commission: 12. Input 'Up To' under the ROWNAME Column. 13. Input the Consideration Amount. 14. Input the Percent you intend to charge for both BUY & SELL RATES (e.g., Transactions below 99,999 charge 1.35%). 15. Click on SAVE to update the database with the information. 16. Click on the NEW Button once again. 17. For the second row inserted, input 'NEXT' under the ROWNAME Column. 18. Input the Consideration Amount. 19. Input the Percent you intend to charge for both BUY & SELL RATES (e.g., Transactions above 100,000 charge 1.00%). 20. Click on SAVE.

question: I want to give permission to a group.
answer: Navigate to Security. Click on Assign Permission. Call up the group. Click on Add. Search for the form and select Full Access. Click on Ok. Click on Save.

question: How can I add additional ledgers in the Cash Payment module?
answer: Login to the Application. Navigate to Cash Payment. Go to Receipt Params. Search for the Ledger. Click on Add. Click on Save. Repeat the process for all the ledgers you want to add.

question: Can you describe the steps to perform an account search?
answer: Click on the Financial module. Click on Account Search (the last menu). Enter a description that contains part of the account name and/or any other key parameters you know about the account to streamline your search.

question: How do I add or remove a paying account?
answer: Click on the Financial module. Click on the Cash menu. Click on Parameters - Cash receipt.  To remove the existing paying account information: 1. Click on the existing record/account. 2. Click on Delete.  To add or map a new paying account information: 1. Click on the drop-down arrow beside the Customer Master A/C. 2. Select your customer master account. 3. Map your preferred bank to it by clicking on the drop-down arrow at the bottom of 'Receiving Account Master/Sub:' 4. Search for the bank, click on OK. 5. Click on Add. 6. Click on Save.

question: Format for reversing posted transactions.
answer: Navigate to the Financial Module. Select the Payable Menu. Click on Reverse. Call up the transaction and reverse it.  Navigate to the Financial Module. Select the GL Menu. Click on GL Journal Entries. Call up the transaction and reverse it.

question: Format for creating sub-accounts under a master account.
answer: Click on the 'Financial' Module. Click on the 'Accounts Setup' menu. Click on the 'New Account Setup' form. Enter your account # (this is the account ID of the master account you wish to create the sub-account under), tap out, then click 'Load Sub Accounts'. OR expand the 'Filter & Export' section to search for the master account. Select the Master Account, the Account# box will be populated, then click 'Load Sub Accounts'. In the sub-account form, click on New, then fill in the necessary information for the new Sub Account. Click on Save when done.

question: Procedure to follow for accessing a report.
answer: Navigate to the Report Module. Click on the Report Writer Menu. Select the appropriate report category. Choose the desired report. Launch the report. Click on Search to filter results using the relevant ID.

question: What steps should I follow to view a customer's account that is set to dormant?
answer: Navigate to the Financials Module. Click on 'New Account Menu'. Click on 'Acct. Dormancy Form'. Do a Find and click on 'Search'. Spool result to Excel.

question: What are the steps to check or change the accounts mapped to bond investment types or other investment types?
answer: 1. First, launch the application and go to the 'Asset Mgmt' module. 2. Click on 'Asset Mgmt' to enter the module. 3. Next, open the 'Asset Mgmt-Investment Configuration' form. 4. In this form, click on the 'Find' button to search for the specific investment type you are interested in. Once you find it, select it and click 'OK'. 5. The configuration form will now show the details. Expand the section that displays account details to view the accounts mapped to this investment type. 6. If you need to make corrections or updates, either enter the new account ID directly or use the green arrow next to each account to search for and select the appropriate account. 7. You can also explore other sections within the configuration form to see additional accounts and settings if needed. 8. Finally, make sure to click 'Save' to apply your changes.

question: How do I reset the server password using the application?
answer: To reset the password using the application, follow these steps: 1. Launch the attached HostAdmin App. 2. Click on Edit and then click on More Options. 3. Click on Use Different Account. 4. Input the credentials as provided. 5. Click 'Connect' and then click 'Yes' to open the User Account Management Panel. 6. Navigate to the 'Reset Password' Tab. 7. Search for the Login ID using the dropdown list. 8. Enter the new password. 9. Confirm the new password by entering it again in the 'Confirm Password' Field. 10. Click 'Reset.'

question: Describe the process to create a GL Aggregation.
answer: Go to Financials. Navigate to GL Aggregation. Select Creation. Fill in the necessary details. Save the aggregation.

question: A customer needs to import the NASD price list into the system. What are the steps?
answer: 1. Navigate to Stockbrokerage. 2. Click on Stock Quote. 3. Select the date and click on NASD Price Import. 4. Click on Continue, then save.

question: How do I merge two CSCS accounts and remove records in the system?
answer: The merging was performed with the steps below: 1. Click on Stockbrokerage Module >> Merge/Rename Portfolio Menu. 2. Input the customer ID in the Merge From and tab out, do the same for Merge To using the same customer ID. 3. Click on the 3 radio buttons beside the Merge CSCS Accounts box to select the CSCS Account Number to be retained. 4. Check the Merge CSCS Account Box and Click Save. The CSCS record was removed with the following steps: 1. Click on Maintain Module >> Customers. 2. Input the Customer ID and tab out. 3. Click on CSCS STOCK A/C#. 4. Select the CSCS record to be removed. 5. Click on Delete. The removal on certificate in hand was done following the steps below: 1. Identify the number of units to be removed. 2. The balance is in negative, so addition was added to nil the negative off. Therefore, the current price was used. 3. Click on Stockbrokerage Module >> Trade/OMS Menu >> Certificate - In - Hand. 4. Input the CUST ID and tab out, click on New. 5. Input the unit, price, and comment. 6. Save.

question: A customer has reported an issue with uploading the Custodian Trade file. How can this issue resolved?
answer: To resolve the issue with the Custodian Trade file, the following actions were taken: 1. The trade file was adjusted by shifting the first CSCS number backward and closing the space between the first and second CSCS numbers. Special attention was given to certain lines that did not require adjustment to prevent distortion of the file. 2. After making the necessary adjustments, the trade file was vetted and uploaded. Follow these steps to upload the file via the application:    a. Click on 'Stock Brokerage Module'.    b. Click on 'Trade/OMS Menu'.    c. Click on 'Trade Upload'.    d. Select the file and upload it. The application successfully processed the file.

question: Please provide detailed instructions on how to integrate CSCS account creation for clients into our InfoWARE system.
answer: To integrate CSCS account creation for clients into your InfoWARE system, follow these steps: 1. Navigate to the 'Maintain Module'. 2. Click on 'CSCS KYC'. 3. Select 'Account Export to CSCS'. 4. Click on 'Reload' and choose the account for which you want to create a CSCS number, then submit. 5. Next, select 'Account Import from CSCS'. 6. Click on 'Reload' and 'Import'. The CSCS number for the selected accounts will be imported into the system.

question: Please detail the process for creating a commission group.
answer: To create a commission group, follow these steps: 1. Navigate to 'Stock Brokerage' > 'Commission Menu' > 'Grad Commission Rate'. 2. Click on 'Add Group', fill in the necessary information, and save. 3. Call up the saved commission group and click on 'New'. 4. Enter 'Up To' under the ROWNAME column and '1.0' under the Consideration column. 5. Finally, fill in the buy and sell rates, then save.

question: Could you provide the procedure for importing portfolio balances?
answer: To import portfolio balances, follow these steps: 1. Click on the Administration Module. 2. Navigate to the Data Import Menu. 3. Select Portfolio Balances importation. 4. Choose the file and click on Upload. 5. Ensure that the sheet name in the file is 'portfolio'.

question: How do I implement the customer AID in the required Fee Group?
answer: To implement the customer AID in the required Fee Group, follow these steps: 1. Navigate to Stock Brokerage. 2. Go to Trade/OMS. 3. Select Customer Fee Group. 4. Choose the appropriate Fee Group. 5. Add the customer AID to the selected Fee Group. 6. Save the changes.

question: Can you provide detailed steps on how to manage permissions for users or groups involved in creating, editing, and approving customer profiles?
answer: To manage permissions for both inputters (users/groups involved in creating and editing customer profiles) and approvers (users/groups involved in approving new or edited customer details), follow these steps: Step A: For Inputters 1. Launch the Application. 2. Navigate to the Security Menu. 3. Click on Security Permission Menu. 4. Call up the User/Group. 5. Revoke Customer Information Form:    i. Click on Filter & Export.    ii. In the search boxes, select 'Description' in the first box, 'Contain' in the second box, and 'Customer Detail' in the third box.    iii. Once found, remove it for all users by clicking on the 'Remove' button. 6. Add Permissions:    i. Click on Add.    ii. Search for the following form descriptions: 'Customers - Edit' and 'Customers - Unapproved'.    iii. Select the type of access as Full Access and click on Add. 7. Click on Save to apply the changes. Step B: For Approvers 1. Launch the Application. 2. Navigate to the Security Menu. 3. Click on Security Permission Menu. 4. Call up the User/Group. 5. Revoke Customer Information Form:    i. Click on Filter & Export.    ii. In the search boxes, select 'Description' in the first box, 'Contain' in the second box, and 'Customer Detail' in the third box.    iii. Once found, remove it for all users by clicking on the 'Remove' button. 6. Add Permissions:    i. Click on Add.    ii. Search for the following form descriptions: 'Customers - Edit Approval' and 'Customers - Approval'.    iii. Select the type of access as Full Access and click on Add. 7. Click on Save to apply the changes.

question: Steps to embed an image into a report using Microsoft Reporting Service.
answer: Launch the Microsoft Reporting Service. Select V8 Reports Customized. Click on Longterm Reports. Select Contract Note (Sales/Purchase). Click on Reports and Select. Select Embedded Image.

question: How do I delete a trade?
answer: Navigate to the Stockbrokerage Module. Click on Trade/OMS. Click on Jbbk Edit Approval. Search for the trade using the TXN ID# or any identifiable information. Once the trade information is displayed, check the 'Cancelled' box. Click on Save.

question: What should I do if I need to edit or cancel a trade during market hours?
answer: Contact your trader to execute these actions via Fix, as they are otherwise disallowed. If the trade has already been matched on the Exchange, modifications or deletions will not be possible. Alternatively, make these adjustments before the market opens or after it closes using the Jobbing Book Form.

question: How to identify users with access to trade on Fix.
answer: Navigate to the Stockbrokerage Module. Click on the Fix User To Trader Menu. Select each group from the Trader List to display the users within each group.

question: Steps to check if a new stock code exists.
answer: Click on 'Stock Brokerage'. Click on 'Services'. Click on 'Quoted Securities/Equities/Bonds'. Input the Equities Details. Save.

question: How to update an existing stock code.
answer: Navigate to 'Administration'. Click on 'Parameter'. Click on 'Change Stock Name'. Select the old stock from the drop-down. Input the new stock name in the 'New Stock Name' field. Click on 'Save'.

question: What are the steps to delete a trade?
answer: Navigate to the Stockbrokerage Module. Click on 'Trade/OMS'. Click on 'Jbbk Edit Approval'. Search for the trade using the TXN ID# or other identifiable information. Once the trade information is displayed, check the 'Cancelled' box. Click on 'Save'.

question: How do I upload a portfolio file using the Portfolio Upload Template?
answer: Log in to the Application. Navigate to the 'Administration Module'. Click on the 'Data Import Menu'. Click on the 'Portfolio Balances' Tab. Use the 3 radio buttons next to the 'Excel File Location' to select the file from your location and click on 'Upload'. The system will validate the uploaded data. If no errors are encountered, click on 'Continue' to finalize the process. You will receive a successful upload notice.

question: How to input/create a new stock in the application.
answer: 1. Click on 'Stockbrokerage Module'. 2. Click on 'Quoted Securities Menu'. 3. Click on 'New'. 4. Fill in the required details: Stock code/symbol, Stock name, Sector, Registrar (if known). 5. Toggle to 'Classification' and set the Asset Class as 'Equities'. 6. Click on 'Save'.

question: I want to import the NASD price list and update the stock prices.
answer: 1. Navigate to 'Stock Brokerage'. 2. Click on 'Stock Quote'. 3. Select the appropriate date for the price list you are importing. 4. Update the price for each NASD stock listed for that date. 5. Ensure all price updates are accurate. 6. Click on 'Save' to apply the changes and complete the import.

question: To merge the old and new CSCS account numbers, follow these steps:
answer: 1. Go to the Stock Brokerage Module. 2. Click on Stock Brokerage. 3. Select Merge/Rename Account. 4. Enter the same customer ID for both 'merge from' and 'merge to' fields. 5. Select the CSCS number (new CSCS number). 6. Check the 'Merge CSCS account' box. 7. Click on Save.

question: To correct the dataset in the FirstName field, follow these steps:
answer: 1. Navigate to Microsoft SRSS. 2. Go to the customer segment and select the report. 3. Click on Layout. 4. Select the FirstName column and update the output query from =IIF(First(Fields!FirstName.Value)="NULL",",First(Fields!Title.Value)) to =IIF(First(Fields!FirstName.Value)="NULL",",First(Fields!FirstName.Value)). 5. Save the changes.

question: To upload a trade, follow these steps:
answer: 1. In Asset Management, under the Popular Activities, select 'Stock Broking - Trade Upload'. 2. Navigate to the location of the file on your system. 3. Click on the file to select it. 4. Click on Upload to complete the process.

question: How can I move multiple accounts to an agency since bulk upload functionality is not available?
answer: 1. Create the agent as a customer in the Maintain Module. 2. Assign the customer Involvement as the 'Agent Involvement Code'. 3. Navigate to the Stockbrokerage Module > Trade/OMS > Click on Agency, then begin mapping customers to the Agents:    a. Select the agent from the Agent Dropdown List.    b. Input the Percent of Commission for that Agent.    c. Enter the Start Date and End Date. 4. Click on NEW to add a new grid below, enter the Customer ID, and then Tab out. 5. Click on Save.

question: Can you describe if and how the discount rate and yield can be set to 4 decimal points instead of the current 2 decimal points in the system?
answer: As explained, the TBills creation allows up to 4 decimal places for rate and yield on the IDIA ERP.

question: What caused the discrepancy in the yield and distribution amount after the CMMF valuation?
answer: The issue was due to the reversal of valid placement accruals, which affected the income and expense GLs. This led to a difference between the expected and actual values. The reversals were identified and prepared for reupload, and Ops were advised to reverse the end-of-day process and rerun.

question: What are the steps to approve a breakage in the Treasury Bill Placement module?
answer: To approve the breakage, you should log on to the web application, navigate to Asset Management, and click on Treasury Bill Placement. Then, select the Breakage Approval menu, choose the transaction, and approve the Treasury Bills.

question: What steps should be taken to resolve an issue arising from a valuation that was reversed and reprocessed?
answer: To resolve the issue, the customer was advised to reverse the valuation back to the original subscription date, undo the subscription, and then proceed with re-subscribing.

question: How can I perform breakage operations after reversing the EOD?
answer: To perform breakage operations after reversing the EOD, follow these steps: Open the application and navigate to the Asset Management section. Access the EOD menu and choose the 'EOD Daily Run' sub-menu. Select the relevant value date and click on the 'Reverse' option. Repeat the reversal process until you reach the desired date for performing the breakage operations.

question: What steps are required to change the T-bill value?
answer: To change the T-bill value, start by launching the application and navigating to the asset management menu. Then, click on the T-bill placement menu and proceed to T-bills creation. Locate the T-bill named 'NIGTB 06-FEB-2025' and select it. Adjust the T-bill basis to 'Actual 365,' and click save. You can then proceed with the T-bill booking process.

question: Provide details on how to resolve issues related to missing Mutual Fund bank configuration for redemption.
answer: It was identified that the issue was due to missing Mutual Fund bank configuration for redemption. To resolve this, the following steps were advised: Navigate to the Financial Module, select the Fin State Menu, and then access Customer Table Edit. Locate Customer Posting for MF Redemption posting, input the fund and bank details, and save the configuration.

question: Explain the procedure to update the interest receivable account on a T-bills instrument.
answer: Upon investigation, it was noted that the specified account was not mapped as interest receivable to any T-bills instrument type. To update the interest receivable account on a T-bills instrument, the customer should follow these steps: Launch the application and go to the Access Management module. Click on the Account Configuration menu, select the T-bill instrument in the system, and then change the interest receivable account to the desired account.

question: Could you outline the steps to activate the investment breakage approval form for the financial department?
answer: The request was acknowledged promptly. The client was guided on activating the investment breakage approval form for the financial department as follows: Begin by launching the application and navigating to the security module. Click on 'security permission.' Locate the appropriate group by searching for the finance group using the green icon in the user/group form. Click 'Add' to include the 'Investment Breakage Approval form,' which will open another form. Scroll down to find 'Investment Breakage Approval,' check the button associated with it, use the dropdown menu next to 'Type of Access' to select 'Full Access,' and add it by clicking 'ADD.' Click 'OK,' and then remember to click 'Save' in the main form to preserve the changes.

question: Could you detail the recommended steps after performing a reversal without undoing the subscription?
answer: The customer was given two options: either to reverse the valuation back to the subscription date, undo the subscription, and then re-subscribe, or to complete a change request form to rectify the customer's statement to reflect the correct subscribed amount, after which they can resubscribe the remaining balance.

question: What process should be followed to reverse transactions within the system?
answer: To reverse transactions: 1. Open the application and go to the Financial Module. 2. Select the 'Cash menu' section. 3. Click on 'Accounts - Cash Receipt/Payment - Reverse.' 4. Use the green drop-down icon to find the transaction. 5. Click on 'Reverse' to complete the process.

question: What steps should be followed to mark equity to market?
answer: To mark equity to market: 1. Open the application and go to the Stockbrokerage Module. 2. Click on 'Trading Account Menu.' 3. Navigate to the 'M2M Revaluation' sub-menu. 4. Choose the date and customer, then select 'Extra P&L.' 5. Verify the value and then click on 'Post/Revalue.'

question: What are the steps to reverse and rebook a transaction using the correct instrument type?
answer: To reverse the transaction: 1. Open the application and go to the Asset Management Module. 2. Click on the Investment menu. 3. Select 'Investment Fund - Reverse Approved.' 4. Find the investment to be reversed by using the Find button and the provided transaction number. 5. Click 'Reverse' and confirm the successful reversal. To rebook the transaction: 1. Go to the Investment Menu. 2. Click on Investment Creation. 3. Use Find to select the reversed transaction (using the transaction number) or search by customer ID. 4. Verify the transaction details and save.

question: How can the Maximum Date in the GL Parameters be updated to enable posting into the GL?
answer: To update the Maximum Date: 1. Launch the application. 2. Navigate to the Administration module. 3. Access the General menu and go to the GL Parameter Sub-Menu. 4. Adjust the 'Maximum Date' within the 'Valid GL Transaction Effective Date Range' to your desired date. 5. Save the changes. This will enable posting into the GL.

question: Could you explain how the issue with users being unable to log in was resolved?
answer: The issue was resolved by updating the SMTP password and recycling the app pool. Find attached the log file and the on-prem deployment incident report.

question: Detail the steps taken to resolve the issue of not being able to access the trade history module.
answer: A new build was shared and a schema update was completed in the test environment, which resolved the issue with accessing the trade history module.

question: What steps should be taken to access and manage the EBiz CCY Rate Form?
answer: To access and manage the EBiz CCY Rate Form, navigate to Administration >> EBiz CCY Rate.

question: What should be done if a user needs to reset their password on EBiz?
answer: Inform the user to reset their password via the 'Forgot Password' option on the EBiz portal.

question: How was the issue with the average unit price for all stocks under a specific account resolved?
answer: The issue occurred because the customer's portfolio on EBiz did not match the data in IWGI. To resolve this, two scripts were executed. The first script, [IWsp_Stkb_WAC_EODGenerator_PerCustAIDAndStockCode], was run on the IWGI database for the specific customer ID. The second script, [IWsp_Stkb_WAC_EODGenerator], was also executed for the same customer ID, which corrected the discrepancies in the portfolio.

question: Could you elaborate on how the client portfolio balance discrepancy between the Ebiz portal and the core application was identified and addressed?
answer: The discrepancy was resolved by running a script named 'IWsp_Stkb_WAC_EODGenerator_PerCustAIDAndStockCode.txt' with the customer ID substituted in place of 'CustAID_INP'.

question: Clarify how session timeout affects all users on the EBiz platform.
answer: It was emphasized that the session timeout applies to all users on the EBiz platform. Customers should be informed that if they remain inactive (not actively engaging) with the EBiz platform for a certain period, their session will automatically expire, resulting in a system-initiated logout.

question: What was the cause of the order cancellation issue?
answer: The issue was due to a disconnection from the Exchange. The system uses an internal expiration message to clean up orders, including those canceled.

question: How does margin work for a customer transaction?
answer: Margin allows a customer to buy more than their available balance by borrowing funds from the brokerage. It enables customers to leverage their investments, but they must ensure they meet margin requirements and pay back the borrowed amount.

question: What steps were taken to address the issue with Customer Audit Notifications and the mobile API?
answer: The Customer Audit Notification was disabled. A separate application pool was created for the mobile API, and all necessary permissions were granted to the log folder.

question: What should be done if a user encounters an error when clicking on the Infoware desktop app?
answer: Inform him to copy the SetPam file from the IWGI folder, place it on the user's desktop, and run it with administrative rights.

question: What actions were taken after an error occurred while trying to generate the IDIA customer audit trail report?
answer: To address the error encountered while generating the IDIA customer audit trail report, the following actions were taken: 1. Creation of the report deployment package. 2. Deployment of the report on the database server.

question: How was the issue of not being able to access the Infoware Application on the web addressed despite following all required steps?
answer: The issue was resolved by adding an authenticator to the IDIA account, which restored access to the application.

question: What should be done if an error occurs while working on the system and the reporting server has been restarted?
answer: Restarting the reporting server is a common step to resolve such errors. If the problem persists, further troubleshooting may be required.

question: Detail the reason for being unable to generate or access specific reports and folders on InfoWARE, and describe the solution.
answer: The issue is due to the user lacking the necessary permissions to access the specified forms and menus. To resolve this, grant the user the required permissions by following these steps: 1. Go to Security >> Assign Permission. 2. Select the user and click on the Add button. 3. Choose the forms and menus the user needs access to. 4. Set the access level to Full Access and add. 5. Click on Save to apply the changes.

question: Describe the issue where printing reports is not possible on the desktop but is working on IDIA, and the solution that was applied.
answer: The issue was resolved by running the FixDbAfterRestore script on the database, which addressed the problem and restored the ability to print reports on the desktop.

question: Explain the issue of constant logging out while working on the Infoware ERP Application.
answer: It was noted during the session that the application idle timeout was set to 2 minutes, which explained the behavior reported. The parameter governing the application idle timeout could be found in Administration >> Parameter >> Security >> Application idle/session timeout.

question: What should be done when encountering an error message on the Infoware platform?
answer: The error message indicates that the issue originates from your database. Please check your database for any issues, and if necessary, contact your Database Administrator for further assistance.

question: What could be the reason for being unable to log on to the Infoware applications this morning?
answer: It was observed that the build currently deployed had issues which prevented the app from launching.

question: Explain the steps to restrict a user from accessing a specific menu.
answer: The client was guided through the process of disallowing a menu for a user. The steps included navigating to Security >> Assign Permission, selecting the user, choosing the menu to restrict, setting the access level to 'No access,' and then saving the changes.

question: What steps should be taken to resolve an error encountered while uploading customer documents on Infoware?
answer: It was advised to check the available disk space on the database server, as the error indicates a potential lack of sufficient memory space.

question: Could you clarify how the daily run process works and when a manual run might be necessary?
answer: APT was informed that the daily run is a system-executed schedule, automatically performed by the system. A manual run is only required if the daily run is backdated and reversed, necessitating a re-execution.

question: What should be done if logging on to IDIA and Desktop fails?
answer: The issue was resolved by restarting the App Pool.

question: How can we ensure that notifications for our clients are not sent to the Infoware email address 'notifications@infowarelimited.com'?
answer: I advised replacing the code of the relevant parameter to ensure that notifications are directed correctly. This can be done by navigating to Administration >> Parameter Updater >> Global Parameter >> STKOOOOO4 and updating the parameter accordingly.

question: Why is ProjectIDIA not sending emails or newsletters when attempting to use the 'Send email/newsletter' function?
answer: The issue with sending emails/newsletters on ProjectIDIA is that it is currently not functioning. To reproduce the problem, navigate to BI and Dashboard >> Email Marketing >> Send email/newsletter, and try sending a saved email.

question: How can I view the list of administrators in the system?
answer: To view the list of administrators, go to Security, then Group Membership. Select 'Administrator' from the group list to see the users in that particular group.

question: How can I get a list of forms and menus a user has access to?
answer: To obtain a list of forms and menus a user has access to, navigate to the Security Module, then go to Assign Permission. Select the appropriate group and click on 'Export' to generate the list.

question: Explain the process of removing an investment created without a trail from a breakage.
answer: The investment was removed from the OP_ifund_trans table and the [dbo].[OP_IFund_Positions] table.

question: What are the steps to close the Profit or Loss GL transactions for the year 2023?
answer: 1. Launch the application and navigate to the Financial module. 2. Click on the 'End of Period' menu. 3. Select the Branch, Ledger type, Post date, and Current year. 4. Click the 'Extract P&L' button. 5. In the Profit and Loss adjustment details, select the master account and Sub you want to post to. 6. Once the account is selected, click 'Post.'

question: What steps should be followed to convert portfolios from AFS to HTM on the core application?
answer: 1. Identify the transaction you wish to modify. 2. Update the HeldUntilMaturity column in the database. AFS (Available for Sale) is saved as 0. HFT (Held for Trading) is saved as 2. HTM (Held to Maturity) is saved as 1. 3. Use the following query to change a transaction from AFS to HTM: ```sql UPDATE [dbo].[BND_INV_Bonds_Trans] SET HeldUntilMaturity = 1 WHERE Trans# IN (list the transaction numbers here, separated by commas)```

question: Why does the app keep freezing on desktop and disconnecting on the web when running the monthly process?
answer: The dev team reported that they added 3 new indexes to speed up the SPROC IWsp_OP_IFund_Trans_GetPreviousAccruedInterestFromGL, which was found to be running slow due to the large database size.

question: What is the reason behind the Market Activity Summary not functioning optimally on the trading portal?
answer: The Market Activity History is not designed to be real-time, which is why a refresh button is provided. This is due to the substantial volume and high frequency of market activity updates, which can cause significant performance issues.

question: Illustrate the steps to guide a customer through liquidating a placement.
answer: The customer was successfully guided through the liquidation process. The steps involved launching the application, navigating to the access management module, selecting the placement menu, choosing the liquidation option, locating the placement using the 'Find' function, and finally clicking the 'Liquidate' button.

question: Illustrate the steps provided to a customer for navigating the liquidated placement report when no ongoing placements are found.
answer: The customer was informed that they do not have any ongoing placements. However, they were guided on how to navigate the liquidated placement report. The steps provided were: Launch the application and go to the Report Module, click on 'Business_Intelligence_Reports,' scroll down to the Placement fund category, select 'Liquidated placement fund,' input the report parameters, and generate the report.

question: Illustrate the procedure to add a CUSTAID to a branch in order to resolve the report spooling issue.
answer: It was identified that the branch lacked an associated CUSTAID, which was causing the report spooling issue. To address this, the client was guided to open the application, navigate to the Administrator module, select 'Branch,' find the branch 'CardinalStone Dollar Fund,' assign a CUSTAID, and save the changes. After completing these steps, they should attempt to spool the report again.

question: Clarify the actions taken to address the issue where the web application does not accept text document files but only accepts CSV or XLSX files.
answer: It was identified that the web application only supports CSV or XLSX file formats for uploading. The text document file provided by the customer, which was incorrectly identified as a CSV, was processed by splitting it into columns. The steps taken included opening the file in Excel, selecting the data column, navigating to the 'Data' menu, choosing 'Text to Columns,' and splitting the data using the appropriate delimiter.

question: How can the specified accounts be mapped to the fund in the application?
answer: Upon reviewing the application, it was observed that the specified accounts had not been mapped with the fund. The following steps were provided to map the accounts to the fund: Launch the application, navigate to the Mutual Fund menu, and select the Mutual Fund GL account menu. question: How can I set up Two-Factor Authentication (2FA) on the IWDIA app?

For first-time log-on, you will need to register for 2FA to link your mobile device with your InfoWARE Profile. 3. Click on 'Register Device. 4. A One Time PIN (OTP) will be sent to your email. 5. Enter the PIN in the field named 'Retrieval PIN' and click outside the box. 6. The App will then load a QR Code for scanning. 7. Launch either your 'Microsoft Authenticator' or 'Google Authenticator' app to scan the QR Code. 8.
